issue.title: Buffer Arduino serial data

milestone.title: Working System
milestone.description: Let's get this up and running so we can actually use this project before we finish co-op!

issue.body:
My test case where I spam the Arduino with messages fails. I need to look into it, but it looks like bytes are getting dropped. A circular buffer might help. 

This is low-priority since the serial protocol is likely to change. However, I'll still take a look at some point.

issue.title: Better Serial Protocol

milestone.title: Working System
milestone.description: Let's get this up and running so we can actually use this project before we finish co-op!

issue.body: The Arduino <-> Python bridge will eventually need a better communication protocol that works both ways. I plan to put together some sort of simple packet format (kinda like an Ethernet packet, but simpler)

issue.title: Geolocation in Python

milestone.title: Working System
milestone.description: Let's get this up and running so we can actually use this project before we finish co-op!

issue.body: For #7, I'll need to figure out how to find the current location of the client. For a browser, that shouldn't be hard. Dor the python driver, ill have to do some research on finding location. I can always look up the IP, but if i can find a better location service, I'll use that instead

issue.title: Unit Test Python Driver

milestone.title: Working System
milestone.description: Let's get this up and running so we can actually use this project before we finish co-op!

issue.body:
Add unit tests for the python driver. Mock the serial connection to the Arduino and also mock the HTTP requests.

This will be a good chance for me to try out making mocks for unit tests, this is still new to me

issue.title: Test Arduino Hardware

milestone.title: Working System
milestone.description: Let's get this up and running so we can actually use this project before we finish co-op!

issue.body:
Create some tests (probably with nosetests and pyserial) that spams the Arduino with data and invalid packets so I can see what to improve

Since this involves testing physical hardware, this should _not_ be a part of the Travis build (else every build will fail), I'll have to run these tests locally

issue.title: Handle concurrent requests

milestone.title: Working System
milestone.description: Let's get this up and running so we can actually use this project before we finish co-op!

issue.body:
Eventually, there will be lots of clients asking for data. We probably should cache quite a bit more data, and then have the API access that cache (perhaps Redis?) This would prevent having to send a ton of queries every time a client queries the API

This might require a separate daemon script that periodically fetches new data, pre-aggs some of it if needed, and stores it in a cache for the API to use.

What do you two think?

issue.title: Config Files

milestone.title: Working System
milestone.description: Let's get this up and running so we can actually use this project before we finish co-op!

issue.body: We need to store certain information like API keys in config files for security reasons.

issue.title: NGINX/uWSGI/Flask stack

milestone.title: Working System
milestone.description: Let's get this up and running so we can actually use this project before we finish co-op!

issue.body: Sometime soon I plan to configure Nginx and uWSGI on my server so we have a more reliable dev server and we'll have example config files if we decide to use this sort of setup in the future

issue.title: Minimal Hardware
issue.body:
Some time in the future, I want to see how small/inexpensive/energy efficient I can make the Arduino client. 

If all it had was the LEDs (and maybe even less of them if needed, I could probably get away with an Adafruit Trinket as a little USB device instead.

This is really just for fun, but if we ever want to manufacture Arduino clients, this might make it easier to do

issue.title: Stop ID Handling

milestone.title: Working System
milestone.description: Let's get this up and running so we can actually use this project before we finish co-op!

issue.body: We eventually need to provide a way to look up stop IDs given the user's current location.

issue.title: Android App
issue.body: We eventually want an Android app. I'd say start with just the ETA, but eventually add a map like in the gui route

issue.title: Create a Virtual Machine

milestone.title: Working System
milestone.description: Let's get this up and running so we can actually use this project before we finish co-op!

issue.body: Eventually we need a virtual machine so we can deploy to the cloud to ensure we can connect to it, even on the go.

issue.title: LCD Display Corruption

milestone.title: Working System
milestone.description: Let's get this up and running so we can actually use this project before we finish co-op!

issue.body: For some reason, the LCD display sometimes displays weird characters. Probably some memory management thing on the Arduino. I'll look into it at some point.
